comment.body:
> [0netdildo](#comment_1_18GtqibgGvk171ye7hVUQ3FHhRqSPnoFtx): so how do i use this information to block these things?

Just do a file search for the said files (e.g. 45bc19354a07d4dfac7cd50e13848029.jpg). If some of them are present on your computer, just delete or replace them with any harmless picture.

> [anonnas](#comment_1_13zDA1QLNorSNQRyEN2boe4r9TCc81atQV): http://127.0.0.1:43110/1MgHVPCE1ve6QfKrgsqCURzRj72HrRWioz/?13zDA1QLNorSNQRyEN2boe4r9TCc81atQV_0 made a VERY simple shell script to replace the files, just drag&drop them on the script (should work on windows if you have git bash or something similar)

Cool, seems to be a pretty simple script!

> [pascali22](#comment_1_1F2DznmVCLfaKw2sVQ9UDVmkkmWaAPShU5): goldenlol

Actually, it should read goldenlolita, goldenloli or goldenlola. Originally I have created these lists for web filtering tools, proxies and such. So I have simplified some expressions to make it shorter and more compact.
